## ğŸŸ¢ Sections 14â€“18 â€” Hydrology & Soil-Water Conservation

### 14 Â· Runoff & Flood Frequency

<table>
<tr>
<td width="50%">

**[`14c_flood_frequency_curves.html`](14c_flood_frequency_curves.html)**

Log-scale return period vs. peak discharge Qp and direct runoff Q for all three basins.

| Return Period | Qp SB1 | Qp SB2 | Qp SB3 |
|:---:|:---:|:---:|:---:|
| 10-yr | 1 279 | 644 | 1 455 |
| **25-yr** | **1 525** | **769** | **1 736** |
| 100-yr | 1 894 | 957 | 2 159 |

*Hover any point to see full storm parameters*

</td>
<td width="50%">

#### ğŸ’¡ How to Read This Chart

- **X-axis** â€” Return period (log scale, 2â€“100 yr)
- **Y-axis** â€” Peak discharge Qp in mÂ³/s
- **Each line** â€” One subbasin
- **Shaded band** â€” 90% confidence interval from Gumbel uncertainty
- **Vertical dashed lines** â€” Design standards: IS:11200 minor (25-yr), major (50-yr)

*Use for: spillway sizing, culvert design, flood zone mapping*

</td>
</tr>
</table>

### 15 Â· RUSLE Erosion

<table>
<tr>
<td width="50%">

**[`15c_RUSLE_erosion_bars.html`](15c_RUSLE_erosion_bars.html)**

Dual bar chart: mean soil loss A (t/ha/yr) and sediment yield (t/yr) per basin with USDA threshold lines.

| Basin | AÌ… (t/ha/yr) | Sed. Yield (t/yr) |
|:---:|:---:|:---:|
| SB1 | 159.7 | 432 585 |
| SB2 | **175.1** | 206 386 |
| SB3 | 169.8 | **571 624** |

*Dashed lines: 5 (slight), 15 (mod), 30 (high), 60 (v.high)*

</td>
<td width="50%">

**[`15d_RUSLE_radar.html`](15d_RUSLE_radar.html)**

Normalised radar comparing the five RUSLE factors across basins.

- R factor uniform (same rainfall zone)
- **LS factor dominant** variance driver
- K and C differ by slope class distribution
- SB2 highest K (thinner, stonier soils at its steeper mean slope relative to size)

</td>
</tr>
</table>

Two panels:

All basins plot far above both critical lines (Ï„_c = 10.3 Pa, Ï‰_c = 35 W/mÂ²).

Order 6: **Ï‰ = 189.3 W/mÂ²** (5.4Ã— Order 5)
